trans-unit.source: Customize: Azure AD Password Management | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Customize: Azure AD Password Management | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to customize Password Management look and feel, behavior, and notifications in Azure AD to meet your needs.
trans-unit.target: How to customize Password Management look and feel, behavior, and notifications in Azure AD to meet your needs.

trans-unit.source: Customizing Password Management to fit your organization's needs
trans-unit.target: Customizing Password Management to fit your organization's needs

trans-unit.source: In order to give your users the best possible experience, we recommend that you explore and play with all of the Password Management configuration options available to you.
trans-unit.target: In order to give your users the best possible experience, we recommend that you explore and play with all of the Password Management configuration options available to you.

trans-unit.source: In fact, you can start exploring this right away by going to the configuration tab of the **Active Directory extension** in the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: In fact, you can start exploring this right away by going to the configuration tab of the **Active Directory extension** in the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: This topic walks you through all of the different Password Management customizations you can make as an administrator from within **Configure** tab of your directory within the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), including:
trans-unit.target: This topic walks you through all of the different Password Management customizations you can make as an administrator from within **Configure** tab of your directory within the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), including:

trans-unit.source: Customizing Password Management Look and Feel
trans-unit.target: Customizing Password Management Look and Feel

trans-unit.source: Customizing User Password Management Behavior
trans-unit.target: Customizing User Password Management Behavior

trans-unit.source: Customizing Password Management Notifications
trans-unit.target: Customizing Password Management Notifications

trans-unit.source: Password managment look and feel
trans-unit.target: Password managment look and feel

trans-unit.source: The following table describes how each control affects the experience for users registering for password reset and resetting their passwords.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes how each control affects the experience for users registering for password reset and resetting their passwords.

trans-unit.source: You can configure these options under the **Directory Properties** section of your directory’s **Configure** tab within the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: You can configure these options under the **Directory Properties** section of your directory’s **Configure** tab within the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Policy Control
trans-unit.target: Policy Control

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Affects?
trans-unit.target: Affects?

trans-unit.source: Directory Name
trans-unit.target: Directory Name

trans-unit.source: Determines what organizational name users or admins see on password reset email communications
trans-unit.target: Determines what organizational name users or admins see on password reset email communications

trans-unit.source: ”Contact your administrator” emails:
trans-unit.target: ”Contact your administrator” emails:

trans-unit.source: Determines the from address friendly name, e.g. “Microsoft on behalf of Wingtip Toys”
trans-unit.target: Determines the from address friendly name, e.g. “Microsoft on behalf of Wingtip Toys”

trans-unit.source: Determines the subject name of the email, e.g. “Wingtip Toys account email verification code”
trans-unit.target: Determines the subject name of the email, e.g. “Wingtip Toys account email verification code”

trans-unit.source: Password reset emails:
trans-unit.target: Password reset emails:

trans-unit.source: Determines the from address friendly name, e.g. “Microsoft on behalf of Wingtip Toys”
trans-unit.target: Determines the from address friendly name, e.g. “Microsoft on behalf of Wingtip Toys”

trans-unit.source: Sign in and access panel page appearance
trans-unit.target: Sign in and access panel page appearance

trans-unit.source: Determines if users visiting the password reset page see the Microsoft logo or your own custom logo.
trans-unit.target: Determines if users visiting the password reset page see the Microsoft logo or your own custom logo.

trans-unit.source: This configuration item also adds your branding to the access panel and sign in page.
trans-unit.target: This configuration item also adds your branding to the access panel and sign in page.

trans-unit.source: Password Management behavior
trans-unit.target: Password Management behavior

trans-unit.source: The following table describes how each control affects the experience for users registering for password reset and resetting their passwords.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes how each control affects the experience for users registering for password reset and resetting their passwords.

trans-unit.source: You can configure these options under the **User Password Reset Policy** section of your directory’s **Configure** tab in the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: You can configure these options under the **User Password Reset Policy** section of your directory’s **Configure** tab in the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The administrator account you are using must have an AAD Premium license assigned in order to see these policy controls.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The administrator account you are using must have an AAD Premium license assigned in order to see these policy controls.

trans-unit.source: These policy controls only apply to end users resetting their passwords, not administrators.
trans-unit.target: These policy controls only apply to end users resetting their passwords, not administrators.

trans-unit.source: Administrators have a default policy of alternate email and/or mobile phone that is specified for them by Microsoft which cannot be changed.
trans-unit.target: Administrators have a default policy of alternate email and/or mobile phone that is specified for them by Microsoft which cannot be changed.

trans-unit.source: Policy Control
trans-unit.target: Policy Control

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Affects?
trans-unit.target: Affects?

trans-unit.source: Users enabled for password reset
trans-unit.target: Users enabled for password reset

trans-unit.source: Determines if password reset is enabled for users in this directory.
trans-unit.target: Determines if password reset is enabled for users in this directory.

trans-unit.source: Registration portal:
trans-unit.target: Registration portal:

trans-unit.source: If set to yes, any end user in the directory can register challenge data by going to the registration portal at http://aka.ms/ssprsetup.
trans-unit.target: If set to yes, any end user in the directory can register challenge data by going to the registration portal at http://aka.ms/ssprsetup.

trans-unit.source: Note: users must have an Azure AD Premium or Basic license assigned before they can register for password reset.
trans-unit.target: Note: users must have an Azure AD Premium or Basic license assigned before they can register for password reset.

trans-unit.source: Password reset portal:
trans-unit.target: Password reset portal:

trans-unit.source: If set to yes, users are able to reset their passwords automatically by going to http://passwordreset.microsoftonline.com, or clicking on the can’t access your account link on any Organizational ID sign-in page.
trans-unit.target: If set to yes, users are able to reset their passwords automatically by going to http://passwordreset.microsoftonline.com, or clicking on the can’t access your account link on any Organizational ID sign-in page.

trans-unit.source: Note: users must have an Azure AD Premium or Basic license assigned before they can reset their passwords.
trans-unit.target: Note: users must have an Azure AD Premium or Basic license assigned before they can reset their passwords.

trans-unit.source: Restrict access to password reset
trans-unit.target: Restrict access to password reset

trans-unit.source: Determines whether only a particular group of users is allowed to use password reset.
trans-unit.target: Determines whether only a particular group of users is allowed to use password reset.

trans-unit.source: (Only visible if users enabled for password reset is set to yes).
trans-unit.target: (Only visible if users enabled for password reset is set to yes).

trans-unit.source: Registration portal:
trans-unit.target: Registration portal:

trans-unit.source: If set to no, then all end users in your directory can register for password reset at <a href="http://aka.ms/ssprsetup">http://aka.ms/ssprsetup
trans-unit.target: If set to no, then all end users in your directory can register for password reset at <a href="http://aka.ms/ssprsetup">http://aka.ms/ssprsetup

trans-unit.source: If set to yes, then only end users specified in the group that can perform password reset control can register for password reset at http://aka.ms/ssprsetup
trans-unit.target: If set to yes, then only end users specified in the group that can perform password reset control can register for password reset at http://aka.ms/ssprsetup

trans-unit.source: Password reset portal:
trans-unit.target: Password reset portal:

trans-unit.source: If set to yes, then only end users specified in the group that can perform password reset control can reset their passwords.
trans-unit.target: If set to yes, then only end users specified in the group that can perform password reset control can reset their passwords.

trans-unit.source: Group that can perform password reset
trans-unit.target: Group that can perform password reset

trans-unit.source: Determines what group of end users is allowed to use password reset.
trans-unit.target: Determines what group of end users is allowed to use password reset.

trans-unit.source: Password Management notifications
trans-unit.target: Password Management notifications

trans-unit.source: The following table describes how each control affects the experience for users and admins who receive password reset notifications.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes how each control affects the experience for users and admins who receive password reset notifications.

trans-unit.source: You can configure these options under the **Notifications** section of your directory’s **Configure** tab in the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: You can configure these options under the **Notifications** section of your directory’s **Configure** tab in the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Policy Control
trans-unit.target: Policy Control

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Affects?
trans-unit.target: Affects?

trans-unit.source: Notify admins when other admins reset their own passwords
trans-unit.target: Notify admins when other admins reset their own passwords

trans-unit.source: Determines whether or not all global admins will be notified via an email to their primary email address when another admin of any type resets his or her own password.
trans-unit.target: Determines whether or not all global admins will be notified via an email to their primary email address when another admin of any type resets his or her own password.

trans-unit.source: Password reset portal:
trans-unit.target: Password reset portal:

trans-unit.source: Example:
trans-unit.target: Example:

trans-unit.source: Notify users and admins when their own password has been reset
trans-unit.target: Notify users and admins when their own password has been reset

trans-unit.source: Determines whether or not end users or admins who reset their own passwords will receive an email notification that their password has been reset.
trans-unit.target: Determines whether or not end users or admins who reset their own passwords will receive an email notification that their password has been reset.

trans-unit.source: Password reset portal:
trans-unit.target: Password reset portal:
